text: Children make you want to start life over.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Friendship is the hardest thing in the world to explain. It's not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Silence is golden when you can't think of a good answer.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Inside of a ring or out, ain't nothing wrong with going down. It's staying down that's wrong.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Hating people because of their color is wrong. And it doesn't matter which color does the hating. It's just plain wrong.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: It's hard to be humble when you are as great as I am.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Age is whatever you think it is. You are as old as you think you are.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Service to others is the rent you pay for your room here on Earth.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: I hated every minute of training, but I said, ''Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: I never thought about losing, but now that it's happened, the only thing is to do it right.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: There are more pleasant things to do than beat up people.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: It's not bragging if you can back it up.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Float like a butterfly, sting like a bee.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Don't count the days, make the days count.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Old age is just a record of one's whole life.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Champions aren't made in gyms. Champions are made from something they have deep inside them-a desire, a dream, a vision. They have to have the skill, and the will. But the will must be stronger than the skill.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: To be a great champion you must believe you are the best. If you're not, pretend you are.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Only a man who knows what it is like to be defeated can reach down to the bottom of his soul and come up with the extra ounce of power it takes to win when the match is even.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Life is a gamble. You can get hurt, but people die in plane crashes, lose their arms and legs in car accidents; people die every day. Same with fighters: some die, some get hurt, some go on. You just don't let yourself believe it will happen to you.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: I hated every minute of training, but I said, â€˜Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life a champion.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: I hated every minute of training, but I said, â€˜Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: The fight is won or lost far away from witnesses, behind the lines, in the gym, and out there on the road, long before I dance under those lights.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: I never thought of losing, but now that it' s happened, the only thing is to do it right. That's my obligation to all the people who believe in me. We all have to take defeats in life.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: If you ever dream of beating me, you better wake up and apologize.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Champions aren't made in gyms. Champions are made from something they have deep inside them. A desire, a dream, a vision.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Champions aren't made in the gyms. Champions are made from something they have deep inside them - a desire, a dream, a vision.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: The man who has no imagination has no wings.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Every day is different, and some days are better than others, but no matter how challenging the day, I get up and live it.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: No one knows what to say in the loser's locker room.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: I hated every minute of training, but I said, Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: If you even dream of beating me, you'd better wake up and apologize
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Friendship is not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: The best way to make your dreams come true is to wake up.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: In the big leagues everyone has ability. It always comes down to mind games. Who ever is more mentally strong-wins.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Rest but never quit. Even the sun has a sinking spell each evening. But it always rises the next morning. At sunrise, every soul is born again.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: It's the repetition of affirmations that leads to belief. And once that belief becomes a deep conviction, things begin to happen.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: There are no pleasures in a fight but some of my fights have been a pleasure to win.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: No boxer in the history of boxing has had Parkinson's. There's no injury in my brain that suggests that the illness came from boxing.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Be obedient to your superior, and your inferior will obey you.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Whoever listens to slander is himself a slanderer.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: The only limitations one has, are the ones they place on themselves.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Superman don't need no seat belt.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: The man who views the world at 50 the same he did at 20 has wasted thirty years of his life.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: The will must be stronger than the skill.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Float like a butterfly, sting like a bee-- his hands can’t hit what his eyes can’t see.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: My way of joking is to tell the truth. That's the funniest joke in the world.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: The greatest victory in life is to rise above the material things that we once valued most.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: No one starts out on top. You have to work your way up.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: The worst man is the one who sees himself as the best.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: It isn't the mountains ahead to climb, that wear you down. It's the pebble in your shoe.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: I hate every minute of training. But i said, don’t quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Love is the net where hearts are caught like fish.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Don’t count the days, make the days count.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: If they can make penicillin out of moldy bread, they can sure make something out of you.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: It isn't the mountains ahead to climb that wear you out; it’s the pebble in your shoe.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: I hated every minute of training, but I said, ‘Don’t quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: I want fifteen referees to be at this fight, because there ain't no one man who can keep up with the pace I'm gonna set except me.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: The man who views the world at fifty the same as he did at twenty has wasted thirty years of his life.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Fifty years old, 212 fights, and I'm still pretty.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: The fight is won or lost far away from witnesses – behind the lines, in the gym, and out there on the road, long before I dance under those lights.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: To be a great champion you must believe you are the best. If you’re not, pretend you are.

text: The fight is won or lost far away from witnesses behind the lines, in the gym, and out there on the road, long before I dance under those lights.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: I’m so mean I make medicine sick!
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Our only hope lies in the power of our love, generosity, tolerance and understanding and our commitment to making the world a better place for all.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: It's just a job. Grass grows, birds fly, waves pound the sand. I beat people up.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: At home I am a nice guy, but I don't want the world to know. Humble people, I've found, don't get very far.
author: Muhammad Ali
